intro: Draba incana subsp. stylaris, commonly known as the slender whitlow grass, is a low-growing perennial herb native to alpine and arctic regions of Europe and Asia. It typically reaches heights of 5–20 cm and features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The species is characterized by its distinctive, slender stems and its ability to survive in harsh, cold environments.
